How and when did you get involved in the festival for Wales Puja Committee?

I said what, what sort of help?

So we didn't know anybody what's going to be like that and all.
So whatever I thought I saw the Puja in our house in India.
My mother or grandmother whatever they used to do in Lokthi Puja or in other Puja, Sharshwati Puja we had in our house, Dugga Puja also in our Desh.
So I remember all the things you know Puja fruits, cuttings and what sort of things we need, five fruits and sweets and things like that.

How do you think Durga Puja and festival has evolved over the period?
As you know a lot of people come from UK and other parts of the country like Middle East and others.
They didn't have much place to go there and offer their offerings to God.
And this is the place they find apart from London, Liverpool, Glasgow they are too far from them.
So they came with their own mind that after all God will bless me if I attend.
And if I get some Sandy waters then it will bring me prosperity in my life.
And that is evolved.
And everybody some friends have gone there and attended the puja.
They liked it very much. They attended Pushpanjali. They attended prasad.
And met so many people, introduced themselves.
And they go back to their place and talk to other friends.
Have you seen all this? Yes. We will also go with you.
This is the way it evolved.
